The Chicago-style hot dog, typically made with a Vienna Beef dog, is a steamed or water-simmered all-beef wiener on a poppy seed bun, topped with yellow mustard, chopped onion, a dill pickle spear, tomato slices or wedges, a kosher-style dill pickle spear, and a dash of celery salt.
In New York, a hot dog topped with brown mustard, onions, and sauerkraut is known as a New York System wiener, or a Coney Island wiener.
